name: Gather Your Records
section_name: Gather and safeguard your own important personal records. Vault
summary: Preserving your own personal records gets you off to a good start and helps you protect your valuable information.

hidden.content: • Gather your important personal documents.

content.text:
1. Locate and safely store your birth certificate, religious records, marriage certificate, legal documents, etc.
  2. If you are missing any important records, arrange to get replacements of them.

hidden.content:
• Take care of and preserve original photos and documents.
  • In storage areas, avoid high temperatures, humidity, and direct light.
  • Identify and record information in photos, such as people and events.
  • Use best practices for deciding on what type of photography or filming to do.

name: Gather Records from Others
section_name: Gather photos and documents of ancestors from others, and organize them.
summary: This helps you learn about your ancestors' lives in a personal way.

choices.name: Contact living relatives or others who might have photos or documents for you to add.

hidden.content: • Find living relatives, and find out what they know or who they think would be best to talk to. Older relatives may have more first-hand memories about documents and photos.

• * Good: Contact a living relative who has additional family history items to share, and then work out an arrangement to share the items.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two to five living relatives.

content.text:
In some cases, these people may have already added photos and documents to Memories.

  1. Click a photo for an ancestor in your tree. In FamilySearch Memories you can click the Contributed by link to show the email address of the contributor (if available). In Ancestry, MyHeritage, and Findmypast, the contributor information appears next to the photo, for other trees you are viewing.
  2. Compile a contact list from contributors discovered in the previous step.
  3. Read the articles for ideas on reaching out to others for photos and documents, and then make the contacts.

    ☆ FS—How to Gather Family Information
    ☆ LDS—Net Results - 2004

  4. Offer to send physical copies of photos or documents to relatives if they would like them.

hidden.content:
• Label photos with as many details as you know (age, name, date it was taken, location, etc.).
  • When physically labeling the photo, use the correct type of writing utensil to preserve the photo as much as possible.
  • Journals, letters, and diaries are some of the most valuable family records, but photos and documents are just as useful.
  • You can often unlock family mysteries by looking through family records. Identify unknown individuals in photos by comparing them to other labeled photos or by taking them to a relative and seeing if they know.

• * Good: Add descriptions for each of the family history items you receive from others.
  • * Proficient: After adding the descriptions, make notes of missing information you want to investigate.

content.text:
1. Organize photos and documents you receive into your collection. Store physical copies in a safe place, and store digital files on your computer and in a backup location.
  2. In a separate document, add descriptions for each item (catalog them).
  3. Make notes of missing information and questions you have about any items.

  2. Create descriptive notes for each interview document you created. These will be used in the upload process.
  3. Use the upload process described in Goal 5. If you have handwritten notes, digitize them first.

name: Prepare Uploads
section_name: Prepare photos and documents to be uploaded. Vault
summary: Getting the right photos that are in the right format will save you time and get better results.

choices.name: Scan any physical photos or documents that you want to upload, or take photos of documents with a digital device.

hidden.content:
• By posting photos, you agree to Findmypast conditions.
  • Posting means you agree that you have the right to do so.
  • Photographs of living people should not be posted without prior consent.
  • Avoid posting photos that are duplicates or poor quality.

• * Good: Scan or take photos of the items you need to upload.
  • * Proficient: Same as above; also make a list of key learnings from the article or video in the Choice.

content.text:
1. Add descriptions for each item.(Scanning is preferable for quality; if you don't have a scanner or need help, you can visit a family history center for assistance.)

name: Add and Manage Media Items
section_name: Add and manage media items in your Findmypast tree.
summary: Media items include photos, videos, and documents for ancestors in your tree.

choices.name: Add and view media items in your tree.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Upload at least two photos and use any four of the steps listed in this Choice.
  • * Proficient: Same as Good, for at least four photos.

content.text:
1. Open the Profile for the ancestor with media items, or who will have media items added.
  2. In the top section, click the Media tab.

  3. Click Add media.
  4. If you want to attach an item that was previously uploaded to your tree, skip ahead to Choice B below.
  5. To upload a new item, select Upload new.
  6. In the Edit Media dialog, fill in the title, description, location, and date.
  7. If the item is a photo, and you want it to be the Profile picture for the person, check the "Set as profile picture ..." box.
  8. Click Save. The item now appears on the media page.
  9. To see the full-size version of the item, click the item or its title.

choices.name: Attach an uploaded item to a person's profile.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Attach at least two items to a person's profile.
  • * Proficient: Same as Good, for three items; also search for media items to add.

content.text:
1. In the top section of the Profile, click the Media tab.
  2. Click Add media and select Attach existing.
  3. Examine the media items on the page and click the checkmarks for each one you want to attach to the person's profile. If "Load more" appears at the bottom of the screen, you can click it to see additional media items.
  4. To search for items, type the name of the item in the "Filter by title" field and click its checkmark when it appears on the page. To clear the search, delete the search text or click "Reset search".
  5. When you have selected all the items to attach, click Add (number) media (upper right).

choices.name: Edit media information or delete media on your site.

content.text:
1. To edit photo information, in the Media tab hover over the photo and click the pencil icon.
  2. In the Edit Media dialog, fill in the title, description, location, and date.
  3. If you want this picture to be the Profile picture for the person, check the "Set as profile picture ..." box.
  4. Click Save.
  5. To delete photo information,
    a) Hover over the photo and click the pencil icon;
    b) Click "Delete" (lower right); and
    c) In the warning dialog, click Remove.
  6. To delete the photo or other media item, click the trash icon and then click Remove.
